headline: Children Suffer From Malnutrition as Israel’s Blockade of Gaza Continues
summary: It has been over 60 days since Israel ordered a halt to all humanitarian aid entering Gaza. Israel says the siege will continue until Hamas releases all of its hostages.

headline: Monday Briefing: Inside Australia’s Election
summary: Plus, analyzing a scene in “Sinners.”

headline: 80 Years After Dachau Concentration Camp Liberation, Witnesses Remember
summary: The anniversary of the end of the Nazi era comes at a pivotal time for Germans. The last of the survivors, liberators and perpetrators are dying, as the far right is becoming more established.

headline: Sudan’s Army Says Paramilitary Forces Struck Civilian Targets
summary: The strikes targeted an airport, a warehouse and several civilian facilities in the eastern city of Port Sudan, the army said.

headline: A Conclave Like No Other
summary: More cardinals from more countries than ever will gather in the Sistine Chapel starting Wednesday to choose a new pope at a precarious time for the church.

headline: Francis Opened Discussions to Those Outside the Church Hierarchy. This Cardinal Would, Too
summary: Cardinal Mario Grech comes from Malta, but is known to cardinals around the world for his role as the secretary general of an advisory body of bishops.

headline: A Popemobile Will Ride Again, This Time Into Gaza
summary: In his last months, Pope Francis blessed an effort to transform the vehicle he used when he visited the West Bank in 2014 into a mobile health clinic to treat Palestinian children in the Gaza Strip.

headline: Houthi Missile Hits Near Tel Aviv Airport
summary: Some international airlines suspended flights, and Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, threatened to retaliate.

headline: Israel Mobilizes Two Reserve Soldiers
summary: The mobilization could indicate that Israel is preparing to shift its tactics in its fight against Hamas.

headline: Oil Prices Are Falling. Here’s Where That Could Spell Trouble.
summary: For countries that depend heavily on oil revenue, dropping prices are worrisome.

headline: Australia’s Prime Minister Wins Second Term
summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese of Australia won in a resounding defeat of the conservative opposition led by Peter Dutton.

headline: Ukraine Rejects Russian Call for a Three-Day Cease-Fire
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky called the proposal a “theatrical show” and said such a short truce would not bolster negotiations for a lasting peace.

headline: Hikers Stumble Upon a Pile of Gold Coins, Igniting a Historical Hunt
summary: The discovery of coins and jewelry in the Czech Republic worth up to $680,000 raises a tantalizing mystery for historians and amateur sleuths: Who buried the treasure?

headline: ‘We’re All in One Ship’: Druse in Syrian Town Rocked by Violence Agree to Disarm Militias
summary: After this week’s bloodshed, Druse leaders in Ashrafieh Sahnaya agreed to integrate militia fighters into government forces. But some residents remain wary.

headline: Cardinal Parolin, Leader of Papal Conclave, Is Also a Top Candidate
summary: Cardinals have talked about Cardinal Pietro Parolin, the Vatican secretary of state, as someone who could have a steady, bureaucratic hand on the church’s wheel.

headline: After Leading a Liberal Comeback, Carney Hits the Ground Running
summary: The prime minister will begin broad economic and security talks with President Trump next week and has set a timetable for his new government.

headline: These Contentious Issues Could Determine Who Becomes the Next Pope
summary: As cardinals gather to elect Pope Francis’ successor, they are facing debates over whether the church most needs change or constancy.

headline: As China Looks for Way Out of U.S. Trade Deadlock, Fentanyl Could Be Key
summary: Chinese officials have long used their willingness to cooperate to stem the flow of fentanyl to the United States as leverage in talks over broader disputes.

headline: Visual Analysis Shows U.S. Likely Bombed Yemen Migrant Detention Center
summary: Videos and photos reveal remnants of at least three U.S.-made GBU-39 bombs at the site of an April 28 attack. The strike killed 68 African migrants, according to the Houthis, a militant group that controls northern Yemen.

headline: The Frightening Precedents for Trump’s ‘Legal Abyss’
summary: The ‘dual-state theory’ explains how authoritarians bend the law to their will.

headline: The Americans Who Left
summary: Some of the United States’ Vietnam War opponents found refuge in Canada. Fifty years after the end of the war, they’re still worried about the future.

headline: Ghana Wanted a Cathedral. It Got an ‘Expensive Hole’ Instead.
summary: The nation had grand plans for a national cathedral designed by a celebrity architect. The $400 million project became a political battleground.

headline: Message From the Russian Military: ‘We Lost Your Son’
summary: Russia lacks any formal, organized effort to account for legions of missing soldiers. That often leaves relatives in limbo, fending for themselves with scant government information.
